news.title: Construction and demolition sites, vehicular emission Trichy’s bane
news.para: Trichy secured ninth rank in the National Clean Air Programme, topping the state, but failed to break into the national top five.  Lack of regulation at construction sites, absence of recycling plants, and emissions from poorly maintained vehicles are hindering its progress.  Despite efforts, dust and debris from construction sites and uncleared silt on national highways contribute to air pollution.

news.title: When Buildings and People Sync: Siemens Reimagines Commercial Spaces
news.para: India's urban landscape is rapidly evolving with new commercial buildings. These structures are becoming intelligent, responding to occupants and the environment. Digitalization and sustainability are key. India is set to be a major office market. Smart buildings offer efficiency and occupant well-being. This transformation is shaping India's future.

news.title: Banks to seek competing bid for ₹729-crore Sahara Star Hotel debt
news.para: Banks led by Union Bank of India are seeking competing bids for the ₹729 crore debt of the Sahara Star Hotel, after JC Flowers ARC offered ₹279 crore. The lenders will initiate a Swiss Challenge auction with a minimum bid of ₹293 crore, aiming for an all-cash sale of the debt secured by the hotel.

news.title: Slum dwellers protest eviction from Old Delhi-Gurugram Road
news.para: HSVP officials faced stiff resistance from slum dwellers and Congress workers in Sector 12A, Gurgaon, who demanded a 10-day reprieve and rehabilitation before demolition. Despite protests and detentions, the drive to remove illegal slums occupying government land proceeded, with HSVP agreeing to rehabilitate original dwellers under a scheme. However, local residents in Sector 47 plan to oppose the rehabilitation.

news.title: Whistleblower seeks Bombay HC contempt action on government department & civic body
news.para: Architect Sandeep Patil has filed a contempt petition against Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation and the state urban development department. He alleges they wilfully ignored Bombay High Court directives. The court had ordered demolition of 65 illegal buildings constructed using forged permissions. Patil claims no progress has been made on integrating building permission systems with MahaRera.

news.title: Redevelopment guidelines in 2019 GR directory, not mandatory: Bombay HC
news.para: The Bombay High Court dismissed a petition challenging a housing society's appointment of a developer without a tender process. The court ruled that the July 2019 government resolution's guidelines are directory, not mandatory. A majority of members approved the developer, and the decision was made under supervision, thus prevailing over a single dissenting member's objection.

news.title: PM inaugurates final phase of Mumbai metro line-3
news.para: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually inaugurated the final phase of Mumbai Metro Line-3, connecting Acharya Atre Chowk and Cuffe Parade. This 10.99-km stretch makes the entire 33.5-km Aqua Line, Mumbai's first fully underground metro corridor, operational from Thursday. The project aims to significantly enhance travel and connectivity in the city.

news.title: PM inaugurates Navi Mumbai airport built by Adani Group for $2.2 billion
news.para: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Navi Mumbai International Airport, a $2.2 billion project by Adani Group, set to become a major passenger and cargo hub. This expansion aims to ease congestion at Mumbai's existing airport and bolster India's growing aviation network, reflecting the nation's economic growth and modernization efforts.

news.title: SC seeks original records from MCA on closure of complaints against Indiabulls
news.para: The Supreme Court has directed the Ministry of Corporate Affairs to present original records concerning the closure of alleged illegalities in Indiabulls Housing Finance Limited (now Sammaan Capital Limited). The court seeks to understand the extent of objections compounded and has asked the Enforcement Directorate to clarify its stance on money laundering charges.

news.title: JK Lakshmi Cement commissions new grinding unit in Surat
news.para: JK Lakshmi Cement has commissioned a new 1.35 million tonnes per annum grinding unit in Surat, boosting its total installed capacity to 18 MTPA. The company also enhanced operational efficiency through debottlenecking at its Sirohi plant. This expansion is part of JK Lakshmi Cement's strategy to reach 30 MTPA by 2030.

news.title: JSW Cement commissions grinding unit at Sambalpur, Odisha
news.para: JSW Cement has commissioned a 1 MTPA cement grinding unit in Sambalpur, Odisha, through its subsidiary Shiva Cement. This expansion increases JSW Cement's total installed capacity to 21.6 MTPA, aiming to meet growing demand in the eastern region. The company plans to triple its capacity to 60 MTPA to become a top five player in India.

news.title: Policy changes powering the new era of India’s vertical mobility industry
news.para: Recent policy shifts are driving significant growth and modernization in India's vertical mobility sector.  New safety standards and tax reforms are enhancing resilience, promoting domestic manufacturing, and improving customer affordability. These changes are creating a more stable and customer-centric industry poised for future expansion.

news.title: TRU Realty to invest ₹110 crore to develop residential project in Mumbai
news.para: TRU Realty is investing ₹110 crore in a new residential project called Spectrum Life in Santa Cruz, Mumbai. The project will feature two towers with 50 homes. Prices start at ₹2.92 crore. Homebuyers can choose from 2, 3, and 4 BHK residences. The project is expected to be completed by 2028.

news.title: Prestige Estates' sales bookings jump 50% to ₹6,017 crore in Q2 FY26
news.para: Prestige Estates Projects Ltd reported a significant 50% surge in sales bookings to Rs 6,017.3 crore in Q2 FY24, driven by robust housing demand across markets. The company achieved record first-half sales of Rs 18,143.7 crore, surpassing its full-year FY25 target, with strong contributions from Bengaluru, NCR, and Mumbai.

news.title: Ajmera Realty & Infra's sales bookings jump nearly three-fold to ₹720 crore in Q2 FY26
news.para: Ajmera Realty & Infra India Ltd has witnessed a remarkable surge in sales bookings, nearly tripling to Rs 720 crore in the second quarter of this fiscal, driven by robust housing project demand. For the first half of the year, sales bookings climbed 48% to Rs 828 crore, showcasing strong market performance for the Mumbai-based developer.

news.title: Residents of east Pune demand better infrastructure in their daily lives
news.para: Residents from eastern Pune areas like Wadgaon Sheri and Wagholi protested at the PMC building, demanding improved infrastructure. Key issues included irregular water supply, incomplete roads, poor drainage, and inadequate healthcare, with citizens highlighting years of civic neglect and unmet basic needs.

news.title: Rajasthan is set to become India's largest cement producer led by Jaisalmer
news.para: Rajasthan is set to become India's largest cement producer, with Jaisalmer emerging as a key hub. Six new plants, backed by over Rs 17,000 crore in investments, will add nearly 16 million tonnes of capacity between 2026 and 2029. This expansion will allow Rajasthan to surpass Andhra Pradesh in production, leveraging its significant limestone reserves and strategic market proximity.

news.title: Rajasthan government defends merger of Jaipur municipal bodies
news.para: The Rajasthan government is defending its decision to merge Jaipur Municipal Corporation Heritage and Jaipur Municipal Corporation Greater. The government told the Rajasthan High Court the merger is in the public interest and will reduce financial burdens. A Congress leader had filed a Public Interest Litigation challenging the move. The court has granted more time for a response.

news.title: Anant Raj shares tumble 4% after launching QIP, sets floor price at ₹695.83
news.para: Shares of Anant Raj Ltd fell up to 4% on October 8 after the company’s board approved a qualified institutional placement (QIP) of equity shares with a floor price of Rs 695.83.. The move aims to raise capital efficiently in accordance with SEBI regulations. The stock has surged over 30% in the last month amid government plans for tax incentives for data centre developers and the company’s ambitious expansion plans.

news.title: Karnataka HC urges state government to frame plot guidelines
news.para: “The intent behind insertion of Section 17(2B) is to ensure that civic infrastructure and planned growth of towns are not compromised while also protecting the interests of innocent buyers,” the order stated.
